intro: Hieracium parypheodes, commonly known as the white hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow with white ray florets, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Hieracium parypheodes is often found in open habitats and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
